alert.note: Alert for Clatsop; Columbia; Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 26 at 8:27PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY ALONG CREEKS AND RIVERS IN FAR NORTHWEST OREGON AND SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON... Starting late Sunday night a strong atmospheric river will spread into western Washington and far northwest Oregon. The heaviest rain is expected from Monday morning through early Tuesday morning. 24 hour rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches will likely fall across the wettest parts of the Coast Range from Tillamook County northward and across the south Washington Cascades. The combination of heavy rainfall totals and added water from snowmelt may cause some of our faster responding streams and rivers to reach bankfull and even minor flood stage late Monday or early Tuesday. The Grays River appears to have over a 50% chance of reaching minor flood stage despite the relatively dry weather of the past 1.5 months. In addition, a high tidal cycle combined with swollen rivers may cause some minor tidal overflow flooding along the coast on Monday and Tuesday.
